title: (x) Corporate serif face for Synoptik (Sweden) - Cordale by Dalton Maag {Sebastian}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018074731im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-2_4524.png)
  
It's the typeface used by Synoptik in Sweden. I think this is something I should have known..
author: fruktbart

comments.content:
Mmh … Christian Schwartz ( [Guardian](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018074731/http:/www.christianschwartz.com/gdntegyp.shtml), [Meta Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018074731/http:/metaserif.com/)) meets Luc(as) de Groot ( [Floris](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018074731/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/fonts/floris/)). I’m curious.  
F
On their site ( [www.synoptik.se](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018074731/http:/www.synoptik.se/ "www.synoptik.se")) there's a Flash file. Anyone capable of see if the name of the font is in there?
That's a solution, but I'm at work without any admin privileges - so no swf hacking for me..

After some googling etc, I found the danish agency Artners who worked on the identy with Dalton Maag. The typeface is from them -  
 [Cordale](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018074731/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/cordale)

You could also have found this using the [Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018074731/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsearch.php), although I admit I had to try a couple of 'a' choices to find it. I will allow another choice in the update.

- Mike Yanega

Good detective work, Seb! Cordale is an interesting typeface.

Mike, thanks for the reminder. I often forget about this fabulous ressource.
